column4: Is there a way to install Ubuntu Server if I just have the Ubuntu desktop version on CD?
unfortunately you will need to download the "server install CD" to install just the server on a fresh install.

the desktop CD has a preset install image, it will install that, there is no way to tweak that until it is installed. however, you can play around more with the "server install CD" and the "alternate install CD" sounds like youw ant eh server install CD.

I agree that sucks. sorry man. But that is the nature of the desktop CD. It just isntalls the image that it is running. You cannot edit it in that situation. Honestly, the Ubuntu installer doesn't offer a lot of control over what is installed. If you want more control, you may want to try Debian.
